{{cpp/title|prev}}
{{cpp/iterator/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|iterator}}
{{dcl rev multi
|since1=c++11|dcl1=
template&lt; class BidirIt &gt;
BidirIt prev( BidirIt it, typename std::iterator_traits&lt;BidirIt&gt;::difference_type n = 1 );
|since2=c++17|dcl2=
template&lt; class BidirIt &gt;
constexpr
BidirIt prev( BidirIt it, typename std::iterator_traits&lt;BidirIt&gt;::difference_type n = 1 );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Return the {{c|n}}{{sup|th}} predecessor (or {{c|-n}}{{sup|th}} successor if {{c|n}} is negative) of iterator {{c|it}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|it|an iterator}}
{{par|n|number of elements {{c|it}} should be descended}}
{{par hreq}}
{{par req named|BidirIt|BidirectionalIterator}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
An iterator of type {{tt|BidirIt}} that holds the {{c|n}}{{sup|th}} predecessor (or {{c|-n}}{{sup|th}} successor if {{c|n}} is negative) of iterator {{c|it}}.

===Complexity===
Linear.

However, if {{tt|BidirIt}} additionally meets the requirements of {{named req|RandomAccessIterator}}, complexity is constant.

===Possible implementation===
{{eq fun|1=
template&lt;class BidirIt&gt;
constexpr // since C++17
BidirIt prev(BidirIt it, typename std::iterator_traits&lt;BidirIt&gt;::difference_type n = 1)
{
    std::advance(it, -n);
    return it;
}
}}

===Notes===
Although the expression {{c|--c.end()}} often compiles, it is not guaranteed to do so: {{c|c.end()}} is an rvalue expression, and there is no iterator requirement that specifies that decrement of an rvalue is guaranteed to work. In particular, when iterators are implemented as pointers or its {{c|operator--}} is lvalue-ref-qualified, {{c|--c.end()}} does not compile, while {{c|std::prev(c.end())}} does.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;iterator&gt;
#include &lt;vector&gt;

int main()
{
    std::vector&lt;int&gt; v{3, 1, 4};

    auto it = v.end();
    auto pv = std::prev(it, 2);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; *pv &lt;&lt; '\n';

    it = v.begin();
    pv = std::prev(it, -2);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; *pv &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
1
4
}}
